member.name: M:HandyControl.Controls.TreeHelper.GetParent(System.Windows.DependencyObject)
member.summary: Tries its best to return the specified element's parent. It will try to find, in this order, the VisualParent, LogicalParent, LogicalTemplatedParent. It only works for Visual, FrameworkElement or FrameworkContentElement.
member.param: The element to which to return the parent. It will only work if element is a Visual, a FrameworkElement or a FrameworkContentElement.
member.remarks: If the logical parent is not found (Parent), we check the TemplatedParent (see FrameworkElement.Parent documentation). But, we never actually witnessed this situation.

member.name: M:HandyControl.Controls.TreeHelper.FindParent``1(System.Windows.DependencyObject)
member.summary: This will search for a parent of the specified type.
member.typeparam: The type of the element to find
member.param: The node where the search begins. This element is not checked.
member.returns: Returns the found element. Null if nothing is found.

member.name: M:HandyControl.Controls.TreeHelper.FindParent``1(System.Windows.DependencyObject,System.Boolean)
member.summary: This will search for a parent of the specified type.
member.typeparam: The type of the element to find
member.param: The node where the search begins.
Should the specified startingObject be checked first.
member.returns: Returns the found element. Null if nothing is found.

member.name: M:HandyControl.Controls.TreeHelper.FindParent``1(System.Windows.DependencyObject,System.Boolean,System.Func{``0,System.Boolean})
member.summary: This will search for a parent of the specified type.
member.typeparam: The type of the element to find
member.param: The node where the search begins.
Should the specified startingObject be checked first.
Provide a callback to check additional properties of the found elements. Can be left Null if no additional criteria are needed.
member.returns: Returns the found element. Null if nothing is found.
member.example: Button button = TreeHelper.FindParent<Button>( this, foundChild => foundChild.Focusable );

member.name: M:HandyControl.Controls.TreeHelper.FindChild``1(System.Windows.DependencyObject)
member.summary: This will search for a child of the specified type. The search is performed hierarchically, breadth first (as opposed to depth first).
member.typeparam: The type of the element to find
member.param: The root of the tree to search for. This element itself is not checked.
member.returns: Returns the found element. Null if nothing is found.

member.name: M:HandyControl.Controls.TreeHelper.FindChild``1(System.Windows.DependencyObject,System.Func{``0,System.Boolean})
member.summary: This will search for a child of the specified type. The search is performed hierarchically, breadth first (as opposed to depth first).
member.typeparam: The type of the element to find
member.param: The root of the tree to search for. This element itself is not checked.
Provide a callback to check additional properties of the found elements. Can be left Null if no additional criteria are needed.
member.returns: Returns the found element. Null if nothing is found.
member.example: Button button = TreeHelper.FindChild<Button>( this, foundChild => foundChild.Focusable );

member.name: M:HandyControl.Controls.TreeHelper.IsDescendantOf(System.Windows.DependencyObject,System.Windows.DependencyObject)
member.summary: Returns true if the specified element is a child of parent somewhere in the visual tree. This method will work for Visual, FrameworkElement and FrameworkContentElement.
member.param: The element that is potentially a child of the specified parent.
The element that is potentially a parent of the specified element.

The element that is potentially a parent of the specified element.

member.name: F:HandyControl.Tools.Interop.InteropValues.WindowPositionFlags.SWP_ASYNCWINDOWPOS
member.summary: If the calling thread and the thread that owns the window are attached to different input queues, the system posts the request to the thread that owns the window. This prevents the calling thread from blocking its execution while other threads process the request.

member.name: F:HandyControl.Tools.Interop.InteropValues.WindowPositionFlags.SWP_DEFERERASE
member.summary: Prevents generation of the WM_SYNCPAINT message.

member.name: F:HandyControl.Tools.Interop.InteropValues.WindowPositionFlags.SWP_DRAWFRAME
member.summary: Draws a frame (defined in the window's class description) around the window.

member.name: F:HandyControl.Tools.Interop.InteropValues.WindowPositionFlags.SWP_FRAMECHANGED
member.summary: Applies new frame styles set using the SetWindowLong function. Sends a WM_NCCALCSIZE message to the window, even if the window's size is not being changed. If this flag is not specified, WM_NCCALCSIZE is sent only when the window's size is being changed.

member.name: F:HandyControl.Tools.Interop.InteropValues.WindowPositionFlags.SWP_NOACTIVATE
member.summary: Does not activate the window. If this flag is not set, the window is activated and moved to the top of either the topmost or non-topmost group (depending on the setting of the hWndInsertAfter parameter).

member.name: F:HandyControl.Tools.Interop.InteropValues.WindowPositionFlags.SWP_NOCOPYBITS
member.summary: Discards the entire contents of the client area. If this flag is not specified, the valid contents of the client area are saved and copied back into the client area after the window is sized or repositioned.

member.name: F:HandyControl.Tools.Interop.InteropValues.WindowPositionFlags.SWP_NOMOVE
member.summary: Retains the current position (ignores X and Y parameters).

member.name: F:HandyControl.Tools.Interop.InteropValues.WindowPositionFlags.SWP_NOOWNERZORDER
member.summary: Does not change the owner window's position in the Z order.

member.name: F:HandyControl.Tools.Interop.InteropValues.WindowPositionFlags.SWP_NOREDRAW
member.summary: Does not redraw changes. If this flag is set, no repainting of any kind occurs. This applies to the client area, the nonclient area (including the title bar and scroll bars), and any part of the parent window uncovered as a result of the window being moved. When this flag is set, the application must explicitly invalidate or redraw any parts of the window and parent window that need redrawing.

member.name: F:HandyControl.Tools.Interop.InteropValues.WindowPositionFlags.SWP_NOSENDCHANGING
member.summary: Prevents the window from receiving the WM_WINDOWPOSCHANGING message.

member.name: F:HandyControl.Tools.Interop.InteropValues.WindowPositionFlags.SWP_NOSIZE
member.summary: Retains the current size (ignores the cx and cy parameters).

member.name: F:HandyControl.Tools.Interop.InteropValues.WindowPositionFlags.SWP_NOZORDER
member.summary: Retains the current Z order (ignores the hWndInsertAfter parameter).
